ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Visit name
Visit number
Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Relationship of respondent to individual
Notes: 1 = Biological mom; 2 = Biological dad; 3 = Grandparent; 4 = Special education (sped) teacher; 5 = General education teacher; 6 = Occupational therapist; 7 = Speech and language therapist; 8 = Behavioral therapist; 9 = Paraprofessional; 10 = Aide; 11 = Principal; 12 = Administrator; 14 = Content teacher; 15 = Parent center director; 16 = Self; 17 = Adoptive mother; 18 = Adoptive father; 19 = Foster mother; 20 = Foster father; ElementDescription: Number of hours spent with patient per week
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Remembering names of people you know or meet
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Remembering how to get places
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Following a TV show
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Remembering where you put things
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Remembering your chores and responsibilities
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Learning how to use new gadgets and equipment
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Remembering information and/or instructions recently given to you
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Remembering what you were going to say
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Keeping track of your money
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Keeping your words from being jumbled together
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Concentrating well enough to read a newspaper or a book
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? With familiar tasks
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Staying focused
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Learning new things
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Speaking as fast as you would like
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Doing things quickly
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Handling changes in your daily routine
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Understanding what people mean when they are talking to you
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Understanding how other people feel about things
To what degree does the following impair day-to-day functioning? Following conversations in a group
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Patient SCoRS Total
Notes: Sum of items 1-20 as answered by the Patient

ElementDescription: Informant SCoRS Total
Notes: Sum of items 1-20 as answered by the Informant

ElementDescription: Interviewer SCoRS Total
Notes: Sum of items 1-20 as generated by the interviewer who administered the scale to the patient and informant

ElementDescription: Global Ratings SCoRS (Rating of overall impression of the patient's level of cognitive difficulty)
Ratings - Patient rates
Ratings - Informant rates
Ratings - Interviewer rates
